questions.question: Which term best describes the rise & fall of the ocean's water level?

choices.answer: Sudden
Ceaseless
Random
Unpredictable

questions.question: Which of the following is a true statement about gravity?

choices.answer: It acts on all matter in the universe
It pushes objects away from one another
It does not exist in outer space
It gets weaker the closer you get to the sun

questions.question: If the sun is bigger than the moon, why does the moon have a greater effect on tides?

choices.answer: The sun's gravity doesn't affect water
The moon is much closer than the sun
Although the moon is smaller than the sun, it has more mass
The earth blocks the sun's gravitational pull
At either the North Pole or South Pole, depend on moon
On the side of earth facing away from moon only
On side of earth facing the moon only
On side of the earth facing moon, and also opposite side

questions.question: The moon's orbital speed around earth doubles. What effect will it have on the # of high tides?

choices.answer: They will occur twice more often
They will occur half as often
They will occur 4 times more often
They will occur as often as before

questions.question: At one beach, high tide occurs at 8AM. When will the next high tide occur?

choices.answer: Noon
4 p.m.
8 p.m.
8 a.m. the next day

questions.question: Which of the following is a true statement about tidal energy?

choices.answer: It's easy to harness
It's more efficient than solar energy
More powerful than energy from fossil fuels
Causes very little pollution

questions.question: What might happen on a beach as the tide goes out?

choices.answer: Sand castles might get washed away
Waves will grow taller and more powerful
More sand for beachgoers to sunbathe on
Sand dunes and other formations begin eroding

questions.question: What might happen if the moon were only half as large as it is now?

choices.answer: There would be no tides
Most areas would receive fewer tides each day
The ocean level would rise and fall less dramatically
Ocean waves would not be very large
Both the solid parts of earth and the oceans
The solid parts of the earth only
The oceans only
The moon only
